item.title: Anthrasimias gujaratensis - oldest anthropoid in Asia, 54.5 million years old
item.description: As seen in the Duke University news:Little Teeth Suggest Big Jump in Primate Timeline DURHAM, NC -- Tiny fossilized teeth excavated from an Indian open-pit coal mine could be the oldest Asian remains ever found of anthropoids, the primate lineage of today's monkeys, apes and humans, say researchers from Duke University and the Indian Institute of Technology. Just 9-thousandths of a square inch in size, the teeth are about 54.5 million years old and suggest these early primates were no larger than modern dwarf lemurs weighing about 2 to 3 ounces.
